text: Ficus bojeri is a species of plant in the family Moraceae. It is endemic to Seychelles. It is a fairly small ficus, or fig, tree with small branches and oval-shaped leaves. It is greyish-brown in color. The fruit hangs from the trunk of the tree on centimeter long twigs. ==References== ==References== * * bojeri Category:Endemic flora of Seychelles Category:Trees of Seychelles Category:Vulnerable flora of Africa Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ficus bojeri
